In short, all characters either ARE mentally fucked up, or BECOME fucked up. Story kinda long but art's is nice. Didn't like the way every character has some dark side to them that just makes reader more insterested "what the fuck is going to happen?" But I think that's what makes it original and... more dramatic. Personally I think ntr should be tagged as some horror, cuz it scares the heck out of me in a weird way (the way that people could be this easily broken). That's just an opinion. G'day to you all.

Honestly, I feel like NTR from years ago is much better than most NTR nowadays. Since the genre wasn't trendy 6-7 years ago, authors had to actually try in order to be successful. I haven't been able to fap to hentai in a long time. Be it animated or panel manga style. Just finished this today in one sitting and it completely shattered my dry spell. So rare to see even a NTR/loli dōjin end so epicly. They usually try to pitifully redeem the story at the end by killing off the rapist or having the "victim" get away. However, this was a true masterpiece. After I fapped I continued to read just because the story was so fucking good. 10/10 without a doubt, I hope more authors follow this guy's lead. All it takes is a quick glance at the news to know stories like this rarely end well for the "victim", if it ends at all. The dōjin should follow suit.
Yeah I still don't get why people like this shit but I won't judge to each their own as they say

It's really funny that the only place I can find absolutely despicable antagonists like that Teacher Sakuma is in some banned doujin works like nhentai. I can't even imagine people like Orihara Izaya (Durarara!!!) or Lelouch Lamperouge (Code Geass) do something like these, or maybe because official manga works are always "toned down"? I mean, you wouldn't find something as extreme as this in any public fictions, not even as a short storytelling bit. Probably Akame ga Kill.

My point is, everything in this doujin's story wouldn't even happen in the first place without Teacher Kazuhiko Sakuma. I'm actually very impressed because of how Namonashi created him: a cold-hearted, fully-hated antagonist that created a major clusterfuck of messed-up drama plot in his involvement of the story. You know he's a piece of shit, you know he has a mindset of a piece of shit, but can you call him a dumbass?
 NO. THAT IS RARE. Just like how GoT fans hate Geoffrey, what a character. What a persona.
